title: Outset (io.macadmins.Outset)
description: Outset automatically processes packages and scripts during the boot sequence, user logins, or on demand.

ignored_users.title: Ignored Users
ignored_users.description: Exclude certain users from scripts that run in the login context (I.e. a local admin account or a static kiosk user).

network_timeout.title: Network Timeout
network_timeout.description: By default, during boot-once runs, Outset will wait for an active network connection before continuing. If that directory is populated, it would check every ten seconds for a valid network connection, timing out after a total of 180 seconds (three minutes) and skipping those items if no connection is successfully detected.

wait_for_network.title: Wait for Network
wait_for_network.description: If you don't want Outset to wait for a valid network connection at all (and you don't want it to suppress the loginwindow process while running scripts) you can deliver a readable preference file with the wait_for_network value set to boolean false.

sha256sum.title: Checksums
sha256sum.description: Enforce script integrity and ensure that only script that you want to run gets run. When used, every file to be processed must have a matching hash value. Absence of a hash value or value mismatch will prevent Outset from processing that file.
